column1: Senate R’s targeted COVID-19 relief legislation would have:   ✅ Protected Small Businesses ✅ Funded Schools & Childcare Facilities ✅ Stabilized Unemployment Insurance   Idahoans need this relief. I will keep working to get small businesses & families the assistance they need.
Vicki and my prayers are with the President and First Lady and all Americans and Idahoans who have been impacted by COVID-19. Hoping they make a swift and full recovery.

In just a few short months #China has:   ✅ Voided Hong Kong’s autonomy  ✅ Expanded internment of Uyghur Muslims ✅ Denied the #CCP’s role in the spread of COVID-19   Read my entire op-ed from @CdAPressNews below: https://t.co/dcvyNSdDH0

Thank you @realDonaldTrump & @SecretarySonny for extending the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program 2 to Idaho commodities like wheat & mink while improving support for our potatoes dairy & beef. CFAP 2 opens Monday--to apply visit https://t.co/TQEQv1PHft.

Senate R’s COVID relief package would have provided targeted assistance to Idaho’s workers families & businesses experiencing the greatest need. I’m disappointed our Democrat colleagues have declined this opportunity to help struggling Americans.  https://t.co/W5RqI7Ce8e

Idaho’s wheat farmers have been hit hard by COVID-19 which is why @MikeCrapo & I joined a bipartisan group of Senators calling on @USDA to extend #CARES Act assistance to our wheat growers. Read more here: https://t.co/66al6ydC0n
Via @EastIDNews: We asked Sen. Risch about COVID the USPS 2 eastern Idahoans detained in China and who’s going to win the election. #idpol @NateNewsNow  https://t.co/3UsWZJ4ojL

Here in Idaho the long-term impacts of the #COVID19 pandemic continue to reverberate throughout farming communities. But even amid this crisis we have seen inspiring acts of kindness from farmers and ranchers across the state. #StillFarming https://t.co/voh97aAivT
Mentorships are a proven tool for #smallbiz success. @SCOREmentors is now offering free advice workshops and resources to help Idaho’s small businesses navigate #COVID19. https://t.co/yywBnP7k5C

I'm glad to see the @USDA's decision to revise the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program to better address the needs of the potato industry. #IdahoPotatoes https://t.co/BoME4jK9jg https://t.co/adoJLIBH08

The #PaycheckProtectionProgram has provided a lifeline to small businesses across Idaho during #COVID19. On Friday @MikeCrapo and I asked @USTreasury & @SBAgov to simplify the PPP loan forgiveness application. https://t.co/0Has32BuSV
.@INL's newest supercomputer Sawtooth is helping in the fight against #COVID19. Read more about it here. ⬇️ https://t.co/XnjT7P0uBP

🚨Attention Idaho farmers🚨 The Coronavirus Food Assistance Program #CFAP application portal is officially open. If your farm or ranch has been hurt by #COVID19 visit https://t.co/TQEQv27iE3 ASAP to apply for this financial relief.

Funding update: Since the start of the #COVID19 pandemic 1142 small businesses and agribusinesses in Idaho have received more than $96 million in disaster assistance loans through the @SBAgov EIDL program.

Cutting bureaucratic red tape remains one of the best ways to help businesses recover from the COVID-19 pandemic. @MikeCrapo & I are ready to work with our colleagues on commonsense regulatory reform for America's businesses. https://t.co/Rg6x0dg9iP

Starting at 10am MT the Mountain Home Air Force Base is conducting a flyover of southern Idaho’s hospitals in honor of the brave Idahoans on the front lines of the COVID-19 outbreak. Thank you to our first responders & @366FW & @124FighterWing for your service. #AirForceSalutes

Happening tomorrow – the @USDA is hosting a webinar for farmers ranchers and ag producers who are interested in applying for assistance through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. Click here to learn more:  https://t.co/NEIfyNqB0W

The reliable movement of goods during COVID-19 and other emergencies is critical. @INL and @CISAgov have developed a tool to help the transportation sector get products where they need to be. Read more about it here: https://t.co/fdO00gX0W4

Small businesses employ hundreds of thousands of Idahoans but #COVID19 has made job security uncertain for many of our neighbors and friends. On Friday April 24th #SupportLocalGems and the Idahoans they employ by shopping online and supporting the gems in our communities. https://t.co/ppn2D2cfWE

Small businesses need every possible tool in the toolbox to weather the COVID-19 pandemic and the Paycheck Protection Program is one of those essential tools.  Full statement here: https://t.co/tNlgkGdl84 https://t.co/ufztIljAOu
The innovation at Idaho's colleges and universities is unmatched. At @uidaho researchers are hard at work on a cure for coronaviruses including COVID-19. https://t.co/ZGT78JHjzF
During the COVID-19 outbreak small businesses across the Gem State are increasingly at risk of shutting their doors. On Friday April 24th I invite you to #SupportLocalGems. https://t.co/vzgoOzPdhc

Thank you @SecretarySonny for announcing $19 billion in support of our farmers & ranchers today. Today @MikeCrapo @CongMikeSimpson @RepRussFulcher & I wrote to @USDA requesting special attention to the needs of Idaho's #ag industry during COVID-19. https://t.co/Fw3LHQvQbN

Idaho’s dairy farmers are some of the hardest working people around but COVID-19 has caused a crisis for the ag industry. I will continue working with the @USDA to ensure Idaho’s farmers & ranchers who have always cared for us are cared for in return. https://t.co/43DJU9HPmN

We continue to hear great stories about innovative Idaho businesses stepping up to fight #COVID19. In Mountain Home In the Ditch Towing Products has adapted its manufacturing to produce face shields for health care workers. Thanks to the team at In the Ditch for the hard work.

Relief is on the way for Idaho’s hospitals and health care workers. Today @HHSGov is delivering $135 million in funding through the #CARESAct to Idaho’s doctors and health centers on the front lines of the #COVID19 pandemic.

Attention Idaho small businesses who have been impacted by #COVID19: The #PPPloan is now available! Apply with an SBA approved bank or credit union for a forgivable loan of up to $10 million to cover payroll through the Paycheck Protection Program. https://t.co/nGJaUQc4UP

Idaho farmers & ranchers are working around the clock to keep food on our grocery shelves during #COVID19. Glad to join over 140 of my colleagues in sending a letter to @SecretarySonny encouraging immediate relief for the #ag producers keeping America fed. https://t.co/xkxbWOYii7
Last week Idaho-based Micron Technology committed $35 million to help those who have been impacted by #COVID19. Thank you @MicronTech for making #Idaho proud. https://t.co/16X8AJdBVq

The #COVID19 outbreak has left Idaho's rural hospitals and clinics especially vulnerable. @MikeCrapo and I joined our Senate colleagues in sending a letter to HHS @SecAzar requesting financial relief for rural providers during this global pandemic. https://t.co/eWvBTHD9O3

Thank you to the talented and hardworking doctors on the front lines of the #COVID19 outbreak who are working tirelessly to care for the sick and vulnerable and keep our communities healthy and safe. #NationalDoctorsDay

As Idaho health care providers work to combat the Coronavirus pandemic the need for personal protective equipment such as masks & gloves is greater than ever. Thanks to innovative 3D printing technologies there’s a way we can help increase our supply. https://t.co/vePBeZb4UH

The #CARESAct is critical to stabilizing our economy providing American families workers & businesses with the assistance they need & ensuring the men & women on the front lines of the #COVID19 outbreak have the necessary funding & supplies to keep millions of Americans safe. https://t.co/Sv8BHVmOLb
Deeply saddened to learn of the passing of three Idahoans due to COVID-19. My prayers go out to the families who are suffering the loss of loved ones from this terrible virus. https://t.co/qGXHu8dZEb

The #CARESAct provides a lifeline to our nation’s economy business owners workers medical professionals and those on the front lines of the outbreak and the people and families battling #COVID19. https://t.co/PF6gxfMjoA https://t.co/5ichdLfH5C

Many of Idaho's small businesses are facing immense difficulties due to #COVID19. My website has a list of current @SBAgov programs available for #smallbiz impacted by this outbreak. Additional resources will be provided as they become available. https://t.co/Xln8oLjKkH
We're blessed in Idaho by all the small businesses using their resources and creativity to help fight #COVID19. https://t.co/HivbrZaDDX

We are in the center of a crisis and Idaho families and small businesses need relief NOW. Deeply disappointed my Democrat colleagues chose politics over the urgent needs of the American people. #COVID19

Ventilators are a critical lifeline for people suffering from respiratory failure. Under the dire circumstances presented to us by #COVID19 it is essential that we get #ventilators to #ID health care providers as rapidly as possible. Thank you @CongMikeSimpson & @RepRussFulcher. https://t.co/dlEoKcsBE5
There's no question that #coronavirus has disrupted life for all Americans. But we are strong. We know how to handle the toughest situations. Together we'll get through this. https://t.co/iZpxO8JxY7

To Idaho's small businesses who are grappling with how to make payroll due to #coronavirus -- hang on! The Senate is moving fast to deliver payroll relief to businesses who need it most. https://t.co/utLnLeKDjC

Our small businesses are facing unprecedented hardships caused by #coronavirus. Before closing your doors I urge #smallbiz owners to fill out a form with @IdahoCommerce to help secure @SBAgov economic injury disaster loans for small businesses in Idaho. https://t.co/ffIwK4fAdX https://t.co/F0h8GQaNV2
Click here to read my message to Idahoans about COVID-19. https://t.co/yvd4T8GBau

We are in the midst of a truly unprecedented time in modern U.S. history. These extraordinary circumstances call for extraordinary measures. Today I voted in support of a second bipartisan coronavirus emergency funding bill. Click for my full statement: https://t.co/EQ1WOCwOB9

🚨Attention Idaho small business owners🚨 If your business has been disrupted or impacted by coronavirus fill out a form with Idaho Commerce now. This will help expedite the disbursal of #COVID19 economic disaster loans to small businesses in #Idaho. https://t.co/ffIwK4xbCx

Today @CDCgov announced that Idaho will receive a $4.5 million grant to help combat #COVID2019. To find out what you can do to help prevent the spread of the novel coronavirus visit https://t.co/it4OZnewB9. https://t.co/yk9xrqsFrF
Read my statement on the announcement of the first case of COVID-19 in the State of Idaho:  https://t.co/GfhhQAXbyI

I commend President Trump and @GovernorLittle on today’s emergency declarations. These actions will help get supplies and resources more quickly to the people in Idaho who are working to contain COVID-19. https://t.co/vWTSYBn5SM

While Idaho has no confirmed #coronavirus cases at this time my office remains open to all Idahoans in need of resources and assistance.  To read my full statement on the suspension of travel between the U.S. and Europe click here.⬇️ https://t.co/jyZ50BurUK

Defending against the novel #coronavirus will take an all-hands-on-deck effort and I thank our public health officials and medical providers for their tireless work to contain this situation and navigate the challenges before us.
As chairman of @SenateForeign I hosted a dialogue this morning with experts from across the U.S. government and got greater clarity on efforts to detect deter and mitigate coronavirus.

I am closely monitoring this evolving situation and am in constant contact with the administration and our state and local partners. I have also requested the @WhiteHouse make more coronavirus test kits available to the State of Idaho.
During this novel #coronavirusoutbreak a speedy and coordinated response is vital to our national strategy of containment. Today I voted in support of supplemental funding to combat COVID-19.

The best thing Idahoans can do to defend against #coronavirus is remain calm vigilant and prepare and educate yourself.  For information and resources on the #CoronavirusOutbreak visit my website.  https://t.co/bFKTRgSHbh

Thank you to the thousands of Idahoans who joined my tele-town hall last night. There were some great questions about #nuclear #coronavirus #USMCA and much more. If you'd like to sign up for future tele-town halls visit my website.⬇️ https://t.co/V7IQaTq1iA
